decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana and spells to build up a large storm count and then finish the game with a powerful Grapeshot. The deck aims to use rituals and fast mana sources to cast multiple spells in one turn, drawing through the deck with cards like Wheel of Misfortune, Echo of Eons, and Reforge the Soul to generate a lethal amount of storm and finish the opponent off with Grapeshot. Defense Grid helps protect the combo from disruption, while Burning Wish can be used to grab the necessary pieces from the sideboard.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the tempo of the game while using powerful creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, Murktide Regent, and Questing Druid to apply consistent pressure on the opponent. The deck utilizes card advantage and efficiency with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Mishra's Bauble to maintain a strong board presence. Counterspells like Force of Will and Daze are used to protect your threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. This deck focuses on a fast and efficient strategy to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play out artifacts while disrupting your opponent with cards like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will. Emry, Lurker of the Loch is a key piece in recurring artifacts from the graveyard, while Urza's Saga provides additional artifact tokens. Card draw power is provided by Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures like Patchwork Automaton and Kappa Cannoneer, backed up by powerful artifacts like Shadowspear and Aether Spellbomb. It is a fast-paced aggro deck with a blue artifact theme.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on quickly locking down opponent's lands with Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void, while also presenting aggressive threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Broadside Bombardiers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure to end the game quickly. With efficient mana acceleration like Chrome Mox and City of Traitors, the deck can quickly overpower opponents before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Shatterskull Smashing provide additional value and flexibility in different situations.

This Control deck focuses on manipulating the game through card draw, counterspells, and removal, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Relic of Progenitus. It aims to control the board and tempo of the game, ultimately leading to victory through incremental advantage and resource management.
